feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The transcript shows the tool produces financial outputs (sentiment score, price/change, buy/sell verdict) and performs computations and comparisons between stocks, demonstrating functioning financial application (Implement and Discover). The student also reflects on usefulness and improvement, indicating a coherent end-to-end financial app workflow, meeting the PASS standard.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows concrete AI features (automated analysis, sentiment scoring, plain-English summaries, comparative output) and an implemented enhancement to compare two stocks, demonstrating the AI adds real value. Driver stages (Discover/Implement/Reflect) provide clear evidence the AI integration is functional and purposeful rather than superficial.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So, it is a 7 out of 10 sentiment score. So, it's a positive outlook on services, growth, and new product pipeline."
"So, and then it will calculate for us. And here we are." / "For Loop 2, I edited the, um, tool. To make it where you can compare two stocks"
"I believe this would be a great tool to use when wanting to invest."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: identified a financial decision context (time horizon, risk tolerance) and target assets to analyze.
- Implement: described calculations, outputs (sentiment score, price/change, verdict) and adding a compare-two-stocks feature.
- Reflect: evaluated usefulness for investing and suggested enhancements (spreadsheet storage), showing practical assessment.
criteria.reasoning: The transcript shows the tool produces financial outputs (sentiment score, price/change, buy/sell verdict) and performs computations and comparisons between stocks, demonstrating functioning financial application (Implement and Discover). The student also reflects on usefulness and improvement, indicating a coherent end-to-end financial app workflow, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "You can be specific about multiple investment options, and AI can help make the analysis for you quickly and easy to understand."
"for Loop 2, I edited the, um, tool. To make it where you can compare two stocks"

"and then it also has a plain English translation. So, something that's easier to understand and easier to read for everybody to be able to understand, even if you don't necessarily have a background in finance."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student identified a financial decision problem and options where AI can assist.  
Implement: student describes calculations and explicitly edited the tool to add a two-stock comparison feature.  
Reflect: student evaluates usefulness (plain-English translation, risk analysis) and suggests improvements (data storage).
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows concrete AI features (automated analysis, sentiment scoring, plain-English summaries, comparative output) and an implemented enhancement to compare two stocks, demonstrating the AI adds real value. Driver stages (Discover/Implement/Reflect) provide clear evidence the AI integration is functional and purposeful rather than superficial.
